descriptionCourse: The course is for those who have basic development skills, knowledge of C# and want to deepen their understanding of game architecture in industrial approaches, and in general - how to make these games.
blockInfoAboutCourseCourseDescription: ACCESS TO VIDEO AND DISCORD COMMUNITY
ACCESS TO REPOSITORY WITH DEMO PROJECT CODE, CONVENIENTLY DIVISIONED INTO LESSONS
ANSWERS TO YOUR QUESTIONS IN CHAT
INDIVIDUAL CHECKING OF TASKS AND YOUR IDEAS IN CODE REVIEW FORMAT
ANALYSIS OF TASKS, IDEAS AND DISCUSSION OF PRODUCTION SOLUTIONS, ADDITIONAL FRAMEWORKS, ETC. ON WEEKLY GENERAL STREAMS
viewCourseScreenText: A course on how to make confident games. This is not a guru course trying to tell you about everything, but instead contains a set of approaches and practices suitable for projects of any scale. The project in the course specifically does not use third-party libraries in order to give a detailed understanding of all parts of the project (DI, entry point, etc.).
After you write this project consistently and together with us, there will be nothing left that you do not know about it. Every corner containing simple or complex code will be known to you.

We created videos for the course based on our experience as speakers. They do not contain hour and a half discussions of slides. They are as practical, concentrated and divided into small portions that allow you to control the absorption of information.

Game development teaches you to solve not only immediate programming problems, but rather problems of the product as a whole. Therefore, we consider both the product code and the setup of its environment.

text: A course on how to make confident games. This is not a guru course trying to tell you about everything, but instead contains a set of approaches and practices suitable for projects of any scale. The project in the course specifically does not use third-party libraries in order to give a detailed understanding of all parts of the project (DI, entry point, etc.).
After you write this project consistently and together with us, there will be nothing left that you do not know about it. Every corner containing simple or complex code will be known to you.

We created videos for the course based on our experience as speakers. They do not contain hour and a half discussions of slides. They are as practical, concentrated and divided into small portions that allow you to control the absorption of information.

Game development teaches you to solve not only immediate programming problems, but rather problems of the product as a whole. Therefore, we consider both the product code and the setup of its environment.

forWhomScreen.forWhomScreenListTextTitle: Take industrial solutions for systemic problems from us and create space for creativity.
forWhomScreen.forWhomScreenListTextOne: Want to spend less time fiddling with unstable architecture and focus on gameplay fun and content?
forWhomScreen.forWhomScreenListTextTwo: Want to scale up your projects? Take our industrial solutions for systemic problems and free up space for creativity.

forWhomScreen.forWhomScreenTitleList: Developers are already in the industry
forWhomScreen.forWhomScreenListTextTitle: Take industrial solutions for systemic problems from us and create space for creativity.
forWhomScreen.forWhomScreenListTextOne: Do you make games but often run into issues of stability, extensibility and support?
forWhomScreen.forWhomScreenListTextTwo: Do you want to deepen your understanding of design and architecture?
forWhomScreen.forWhomScreenListTextThree: Do you want to expand your toolbox? Then you are welcome to join us!

forWhomScreen.forWhomScreenTitleList: .Net Developers who want to get into gamedev
forWhomScreen.forWhomScreenListTextTitle: Take industrial solutions for systemic problems from us and create space for creativity.
forWhomScreen.forWhomScreenListTextOne: Have you always wanted to make games, but it didn't work out?
forWhomScreen.forWhomScreenListTextTwo: We'll tell you what parts games consist of, how to think when solving typical problems, and how to write games so that they work as a coherent system.
forWhomScreen.forWhomScreenListTextThree: After the course, you'll know enough to move into the gaming industry.

descriptionSpeaker: 12 years of development experience. CEO of Black Tower Basement.
Previous: Unity Software Architect on Raid: Shadow Legends and several other world-class mobile projects.
10 years of experience in developing and leading a project team.
CTO Black Tower Basement. In the past: Client Team Lead on Raid: Shadow Legends and Shadow Legends and several other large-scale projects

speakerScreenGeneralInformation.generalInfo: After leaving Plarium in early 2020, we switched to full-time implementation of our own ideas and projects (including this school.
speakerScreenGeneralInformation.generalInfoListTitle: The course speakers have extensive experience in public speaking.

topics.highlight: | Correctly implementing unit tests in a Unity project

fourGamesScreen.shortDescription: MMO-Collection RPG (Battler). More than a million players per day. iOS, Android, Mac, PC.
descriptionGame: The most high-load and scalable server among all projects;
The client combines ECS in core gameplay and MVVM for the meta-game;
Covered by a huge number of various unit, visual, and integration tests;
Integration with Twitch and Amazon; an advanced CI system.

fourGamesScreen.shortDescription: MMO-Strategy. 4+ years in release, 2,000,000+ installations on iOS, Android.
descriptionGame: Shared core support with the Stormfall project while maintaining a large amount of unique functionality in each project;
Managing a large number of loaded resources;

fourGamesScreen.shortDescription: MMO-Strategy. 4+ years in release, 2,000,000+ installations on iOS, Android.
descriptionGame: A system ensuring user data consistency;
Feature versioning and backward compatibility support;

fourGamesScreen.shortDescription: MMO-Strategy. 4+ years in release, 2,000,000+ installations on iOS, Android.
descriptionGame: Experience in a complete engine switch and retraining the team from the Cocos2d and C++ stack to Unity and C#;
Support for exotic devices (e.g., Amazon Kindle);

fourGamesScreen.shortDescription: An ironic, bloody and demanding linear point'n'slash RPG in detailed pixel art.
fourGamesScreen.descriptionGame: The first project of the indie studio of our speakers Black Tower Basement. From a pet project to release, it has gone through many transformations and tested the architecture that we talk about in the courses.

fourGamesScreenGeneralText: *Images and names of game projects RAID: Shadow Legends, Soldiers Inc: Mobile Warfare, Stormfall: Rise of Balur and Total Domination â€“ Reborn belong to their rightful owners â€“ Plarium Global Ltd.

insideScreen.insideScreenTitle: Setting up the environment for work
insideScreen.insideScreenContent: Let's organize one of the convenient ways to save and load\update data on the player's progress and state. At the same time, we will get a special place for this and avoid problems with the initialization order.
